Pre-Game Insights: Croatia have failed to win any of their last four matches.
Poland have scored in six consecutive games but have yet to keep a clean sheet in the same period.
Croatia’s current winless run includes two draws, indicating a high chance of shared points.
Both Stoke and Hull have struggled in attack, scoring just five goals combined in their league matches.
Poland have shown resilience by finding the back of the net in six consecutive games, making them dangerous in attack, particularly with Robert Lewandowski leading the line.
Croatia’s midfield duo of Luka Modric and Mateo Kovacic remains formidable, but the lack of a reliable backline could expose them to Poland’s attacking threats.
Poland have managed to find ways to win or draw tight matches.
Croatia’s defence is lacking cohesion, while Poland have struggled to keep clean sheets.
Both teams to score is a logical conclusion, and a low-scoring draw fits perfectly with the tactical setup each side is likely to employ.
Post-Match Reflections: Croatia’s lack of defensive cohesion, paired with Poland’s attacking prowess, makes the Draw/Poland Double Chance the standout choice here.
Poland’s ability to score, coupled with Croatia’s struggles, suggests a low-risk, high-reward bet.
A draw is also consistent with the idea that both teams are not at their peak performance levels.
